Class BufferedIOStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      BufferedIOStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable
public class BufferedIOStream
extends InputStream

Class that turns an output stream into an input stream. The internal buffer grows if writting rate is higher than reading rate. TODO

  • Implement long skip(long) to improve performance

Nested Class Summary

Field Detail

_buffer

private byte[] _buffer
The circular buffer to hold the data. When we overflow the buffer, it grows.

_start

private int _start
The location to read the next byte. _size must be > 0 to be meaningful.

_next

private int _next
The next available location to store a byte. Only meaningful if not equal to _start.

_size

private int _size
The size of the data in the buffer. Mainly used when _start == _next to see if buffer is empty or full.

_highWaterMark

private int _highWaterMark
The most bytes in the buffer at any time

_out

private BufferedIOStream._OutputStream _out
The OutputStream. This is a singleton per BufferedIOStream that gets created at construction and removed at close.

Constructor Detail

BufferedIOStream

public BufferedIOStream()
A stream with a default 4k buffer.

BufferedIOStream

public BufferedIOStream(int initialBuffer)
A stream with the suggested buffer.

Parameters:
initialBuffer - The initial buffer size. If buffer is less than 2, buffer will be 512 bytes.

read

public int read(byte[] b)
         throws IOException
Read bytes directly into a buffer. The number of bytes actually read will be the lesser of b.length and available().

Overrides:
read in class InputStream
Parameters:
b - Buffer to read bytes into
Returns:
-1 for end of stream, or number of bytes actually read.
Throws:
IOException

read

public int read(byte[] b,
                int off,
                int len)
         throws IOException
Reads up to a number of bytes directly into a given buffer. The number of bytes actually read will be the lesser of len, b.length, available().

Overrides:
read in class InputStream
Parameters:
b - Buffer to read bytes into
off - The offset to start storing the bytes
len - The maximum number of bytes to store
Returns:
-1 for end of stream, or number of bytes actually read.
Throws:
IOException - If stream is closed or someone notified us but there is not data in the buffer and the OutputStream has not been closed.

                    throws IOException
Does all the preflight checking for a read call.

Throws:
IOException - If stream is closed or someone notified us but there is not data in the buffer and the OutputStream has not been closed.

_read

private int _read(byte[] b,
                  int off,
                  int len)
           throws IOException
Reads up to a number of bytes directly into a given buffer. The number of bytes actually read will be the lesser of len, b.length, available().

Parameters:
b - Buffer to read bytes into
off - The offset to start storing the bytes
len - The maximum number of bytes to store
Returns:
-1 for end of stream, or number of bytes actually read.
Throws:
IOException - If stream is closed or someone notified us but there is not data in the buffer and the OutputStream has not been closed.

_read

private int _read()
           throws IOException
Reads one byte from the buffer and blocks if there is none.

Returns:
The next byte, or -1 if we've read everything and the OutputStream has been closed.
Throws:
IOException - If stream is closed or someone notified us but there is not data in the buffer and the OutputStream has not been closed.

_ensureBufferSize

private void _ensureBufferSize(int addAmount)
Ensure there is enough room in the buffer to add some data. If there is not enough room in _buffer to add addAmount bytes of data, then the buffer will grow by either 50% or 2x addAmount, whichever is bigger.

Parameters:
addAmount - The number of bytes that should fit in _buffer

_write

private int _write(byte[] b,
                   int off,
                   int len,
                   int bufferOffset)
Writes data to _buffer at the given offset.

Parameters:
b - The buffer of data
off - The offset in the buffer
len - The number of bytes to store off
bufferOffset - The offset in the buffer to write the bytes
Returns:
The offset just past the last byte written

_write

private void _write(byte[] b,
                    int off,
                    int len)
Write bytes from a buffer to the storage buffer. If the buffer is full, a larger buffer is created, and data is reorganized at the beginning of the buffer.

Parameters:
b - The buffer of data
off - The offset in the buffer
len - The number of bytes to store off

_putback

private void _putback(byte[] b,
                      int off,
                      int len)
Puts bytes back into the stream.

Parameters:
b - The buffer of data
off - The offset in the buffer
len - The number of bytes to put back

_putback

private void _putback(int b)
Puts a single byte back into the stream.

Parameters:
b - The byte to put back

_write

private void _write(int b)
Write a single byte to the buffer. If the buffer is full, a larger buffer is created, and data is reorganized at the beginning of the buffer.

Parameters:
b - The byte to write. b will be typecast to a byte and will be written regardless of the size of the value of b.

_endOfStream

private boolean _endOfStream()
Determines if the output stream has been closed and the buffer is empty.

_closed

private boolean _closed()
Determines if the input stream has been closed.

Returns:
true if close has already been called on this input stream.

_closeOutputStream

private void _closeOutputStream()
Closes the output stream and notifies any readers waiting on read to wake up.

main

public static void main(String... args)
Test. Test expanding the buffer with data split at the beginning and end of the buffer. Also tests expanding when all data is at the beginning of the buffer. Tests all three reads. Tests write byte and write buffer (does not test write partial buffer).
